intro: Zephyranthes rosea, commonly known as the rain lily, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and Central America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink or white flowers that bloom after rainfall. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It produces strap-like leaves and has a bulbous root system that helps it survive dry periods. Zephyranthes rosea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in gardens.
